titles: Strange news from Bishops-Stafford near Buckingham. Licensed, April 26th, 1694. Amidst the various clans of enthusiasts who being led astray thro blind ways by their distemper'd brains and fantastick notions, ... such confusion and madness, I never expected to see, unless in Bedlam.
publisher: printed for Randel Taylor, near Stationers-hall,
notes: The word "Stafford" has the letters "r" and "t" inserted in manuscript above "t" and "a" respectively.
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
